org.kitteh.irc.client.library

Interface Client


  • public interface Client
    An individual IRC connection, see ClientBuilder to create one.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • addChannel

        void addChannel(@Nonnull
                String... channel)
        Adds channels to this client.

        Joins the channel if already connected.

        Parameters:
        channel - channel(s) to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null

      • addChannel

        void addChannel(@Nonnull
                Channel... channel)
        Adds channels to this client.

        Joins the channel if already connected.

        Parameters:
        channel - channel(s) to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null

      • getChannel

        @Nullable
Channel getChannel(@Nonnull
                              String name)
        Gets the named channel.
        Parameters:
        name - channel name
        Returns:
        a channel snapshot of the named channel or null if no longer known to the Client
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if name is null
        See Also:
        getChannels()

      • getChannels

        @Nonnull
Set<Channel> getChannels()
        Gets the channels in which the client is currently present.
        Returns:
        the client's current channels

      • getEventManager

        @Nonnull
EventManager getEventManager()
        Gets the client's event manager.
        Returns:
        the event manager for this client

      • getIntendedNick

        @Nonnull
String getIntendedNick()
        Gets the nickname the client intends to possess. May not reflect the current nickname if it's taken. The client will automatically attempt to take back this nickname.

        Use getNick() for the current nick.

        Returns:
        the nickname the client tries to maintain

      • getMessageDelay

        int getMessageDelay()
        Gets the delay between messages sent to the server.

        Default is 1200ms.

        Returns:
        milliseconds between sent messages

      • getName

        @Nonnull
String getName()
        Gets the client name. This name is just an internal name for reference and is not visible from IRC.
        Returns:
        the client name

      • getNick

        @Nonnull
String getNick()
        Gets the current nickname the client has.
        Returns:
        the current nick

      • getServerInfo

        @Nonnull
ServerInfo getServerInfo()
        Gets information about the server to which the client is currently connected. As long as the client remains connected the information returned by this object will update according to information received from the server. A new one can be acquired from ClientConnectedEvent
        Returns:
        the server information object

      • removeChannel

        void removeChannel(@Nonnull
                   String channel,
                   @Nullable
                   String reason)
        Removes a channel from the client, leaving as necessary.
        Parameters:
        channel - channel to leave
        reason - part reason or null to not send a reason
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channel is null

      • removeChannel

        void removeChannel(@Nonnull
                   Channel channel,
                   @Nullable
                   String reason)
        Removes a channel from the client, leaving as necessary.
        Parameters:
        channel - channel to leave
        reason - part reason or null to not send a reason
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channel is null

      • sendCTCPMessage

        void sendCTCPMessage(@Nonnull
                     String target,
                     @Nonnull
                     String message)
        Sends a CTCP message to a target user or channel. Automagically adds the CTCP delimiter around the message and escapes the characters that need escaping when sending a CTCP message.

        Note: CTCP replies should not be sent this way. Catch the message with the PrivateCTCPQueryEvent

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendCTCPMessage

        void sendCTCPMessage(@Nonnull
                     MessageReceiver target,
                     @Nonnull
                     String message)
        Sends a CTCP message to a target user or channel. Automagically adds the CTCP delimiter around the message and escapes the characters that need escaping when sending a CTCP message.

        Note: CTCP replies should not be sent this way. Catch the message with the PrivateCTCPQueryEvent

        Parameters:
        target - the destination of the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • sendRawLine

        void sendRawLine(@Nonnull
                 String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • sendRawLineAvoidingDuplication

        void sendRawLineAvoidingDuplication(@Nonnull
                                    String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message, unless the exact same message is already in the queue of messages not yet sent.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • sendRawLineImmediately

        void sendRawLineImmediately(@Nonnull
                            String message)
        Sends a raw IRC message, disregarding message delays and all sanity. Live life on the wild side with this method designed to ensure you get floodkicked before you finish dumping your life's work into chat.
        Parameters:
        message - message to send dangerously, you monster
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if message is null

      • setAuth

        void setAuth(@Nonnull
             AuthType authType,
             @Nonnull
             String name,
             @Nonnull
             String pass)
        Sets values for authentication with services on the server. The client will not attempt to utilize them until a future reconnect.
        Parameters:
        authType - type of authentication (See AuthType)
        name - username
        pass - password
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for null parameters

      • setExceptionListener

        void setExceptionListener(@Nullable
                          Consumer<Exception> listener)
        Sets a listener for all thrown exceptions on this client.

        All exceptions are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - catcher of throwables

      • setInputListener

        void setInputListener(@Nullable
                      Consumer<String> listener)
        Sets a listener for all incoming messages from the server.

        All messages are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - input listener

      • setMessageDelay

        void setMessageDelay(int delay)
        Sets the delay between messages sent to the server.

        Default is 1200ms.

        Parameters:
        delay - milliseconds between sent messages

      • setNick

        void setNick(@Nonnull
             String nick)
        Sets the nick the client wishes to use.
        Parameters:
        nick - new nickname
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if nick is null

      • setOutputListener

        void setOutputListener(@Nullable
                       Consumer<String> listener)
        Sets a listener for all outgoing messages to the server.

        All messages are passed from a single, separate thread.

        Parameters:
        listener - output listener

      • shutdown

        void shutdown(@Nullable
              String reason)
        Shuts down the client.
        Parameters:
        reason - quit message to send, null for blank message
